Case reference: 2005002599.CaseDesc: On October 21, 1989, an unidentified man was discovered in the area of County Road 14 in Napanee, Ontario.  Biogeographic ancestry testing predicts that this man was of south Asian ancestry.

Shirt: White, DRESS, Brand: Pierre Cardin; grey, blue, and red thin stripes

Case reference: 2014003731.CaseDesc: On October 30, 1964 at 1:00 p.m. Murray Hansen left Berens River, Manitoba to go to Black River to deliver some items to a family member. At approximately 3:00 p.m. that day it started to storm and the water on the lake became rough. Mr. Hansen planned to stay in Black River overnight and then return to Berens River. When 5 days passed and he hadn't returned home, his wife began to look for him and discovered that he had never arrived in Black River. On November 3, 1964, Mr. Hansen's boat was found turned over near Bigstone Point and was approximately 100 yards from the shore. Searches were done by air, land and boat but the body of Mr. Hansen was never recovered. Murray Hansen is presumed dead due to drowning.

Case reference: 2005002199.CaseDesc: On April 19, 1980, a Caucasian male was found at a campsite (Lot 19, Con 8, Peck Township) on Hardwood Lookout Trail in Algonquin Park. The death is estimated to have occurred between July 1, 1971 and Spring 1978.

Hair: Blonde, Long, Possibly in a ponytail
Belt: 36 inch, wear shown at 32 inch hole
Other: A folding camp stove; and an aluminum camper's pot with a lid
A black down-filled sleeping bag with a nylon outer shell
Wallet: Black, with 8 cent stamp issues between July 1, 1971 and September 1, 1976

Case reference: 2014005263.CaseDesc: On November 1, 2007, Annie Proulx was seen for the last time in the Rimouski area in Quebec. Annie has not been seen or heard from since.

Tattoo: Right Upper Arm, Rose, Heart and Bulldog

Case reference: 2014002919.CaseDesc: On November 12, 1988, Andrée Thibault was seen for the last time the Sainte-Marie District in Montreal, Quebec. Andrée may have been seen in Western Canada in the Vancouver, British-Columbia area.

Case reference: 2013000117.CaseDesc: On July 3, 1960, police received a report of a lost child in the Red Lake area, 72 km Northwest of Kamloops. 21-month-old Edna Bette-Jean Masters known to the family as Bette-Jean, was last seen playing with family and friends at a friend's residence.

Deformity: Ears, Slight bent ear lobe, unknown which ear
Scar: Left Upper Arm, Oval shape burn scar

Case reference: 2016034139.CaseDesc: Jessie Lobban has not been seen since June 16, 2016 when he left his residence at an unknown time. Jessie left behind his vehicle and his bicycle. This is out of character for him and his family is concerned.

Deformity: Left Little Finger, Tip bent inward
Right Little Finger, Tip bent inward

Case reference: 2019060163.CaseDesc: On April 7, 2019, Ashley Arason was seen for the last time by her family in Winnipeg, Manitoba. Ashley had missed her son’s birthday, and this was something that was out of character

Tattoo: Right Ankle, Musical notes on a staff
Left Ankle, Chinese writing, strength, butterfly, musical note

Case reference: 2015039943.CaseDesc: A family member reported that they had not seen Clarence Bigeye since 1974.

Case reference: 2005005699.CaseDesc: On June 22, 1991, the body of an unidentified man was recovered from the Niagara River between Horseshoe Falls and the "Maid of the Mist" boat docks. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 113 lbs, however this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. He had signs of having suffered an acute or chronic right lung infection. He is estimated to have been dead for several months. Biogeographic Ancestry testing predicts this unidentified male is either of European ancestry, or South Asian ancestry, or mixed European and South Asian ancestry.

Teeth: Several amalgam fillings in his teeth and multiple posterior teeth in his upper and lower jaw were lost/removed prior to death.

Case reference: 2010003799.CaseDesc: On Wednesday August 16, 1972, at 9:40 pm, 14 year-old Ingrid Bauer left her residence in Kleinburg, now the city of Vaughan, enroute to meet her boyfriend at his North Woodbridge home. She was last seen hitchhiking southbound along the west side of Islington Avenue.  She never arrived at her boyfriend’s residence that night.  An extensive search based on information received from the public failed to locate Ingrid Bauer.

Case reference: 2016008383.CaseDesc: On December 18, 2015, Adam Kazibwe was last seen at his school in Brampton.  It is believed that on February 18, 2016, Adam's mother Rosemarie Tumusiime and father Robert Kazibwe, travelled from Brampton to Kabale, Uganda with their twin children Adam and Destiny.  Further investigation has not been able to confirm the well-being of Adam or of his sister Destiny.

Case reference: 2014002240.CaseDesc: On October 17, 1993, Marcus Laing was reported missing when he failed to show up for work which was out of character for him.

Case reference: 2019033665.CaseDesc: On July 18, 1988, the remains of a male were found in a field on the side of road 132 in Tracy, Québec. A camp was found near the remains.

Case reference: 2017073538.CaseDesc: On October 15, 2016, an unidentified man was located at Lake Huron Beach, north of Nine Mile River in Goderich, Ontario. The man previously identified himself as Mitchell Nelson. He travelled extensively by bicycle, and was believed to be from Alberta.

Case reference: 2012020097.CaseDesc: On November 15, 1986, Corrine Moosomin was last seen at approximately 4:00 a.m. on the Saulteaux First Nation near North Battleford, Saskatchewan. She was last seen walking on a grid road. Corrine was reported missing and extensive searches failed to locate her.

Case reference: 1998000820.CaseDesc: Tom Marsden was last seen at a bush party near Summit Lake north of the City of Prince George.

Case reference: 2020006266.CaseDesc: On February 25, 1959, Richard "Ricky" Culford was seen for the last time on Ward’s Island in Toronto, Ontario. He was last seen playing on the beach with a stick. When his mother went to retrieve him, Ricky was gone.

Hat: Brown, Gabardine helmet with a peak

Case reference: 2014005915.CaseDesc: On October 30, 2012, at approximately 8:00 a.m., Frank Fuernkranz was seen for the last time on vacation in Panama. Frank had left to go for a walk, but never returned.

Case reference: 2023001519.CaseDesc: On January 9, 2023, Krystal Russell was reported missing. The last footprint of life for Krystal Russell is December 31, 2022.

Case reference: 2006010699.CaseDesc: Greg Gan departed from the family home, on foot, on October 19, 1978. He has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014002562.CaseDesc: Michael Megraw, from Minnesota, USA, had visited the Katamik Lake area with his brother to go fishing over the September Labour Day weekend in September 1992.  Michael had returned to the US but was reported missing just days later, family indicated he was last seen on September 11, 1992.  RCMP received a call on October 3, 1992, about a truck at Katamik Lake which didn't appear to have been moved since September 24th; Mr. Megraw was determined to be the registered owner.  It is believed he returned to the lake somewhere between September 11 and September 24, 1992. Mr. Megraw has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014005727.CaseDesc: Ryan Slobodzian was last seen when he was dropped off on Henry Avenue. Mr. Slobodzian has not been located and his whereabouts remain unknown.

Backpack: Unknown, May have been carrying at time of disappearance

Case reference: 2019016881.CaseDesc: On March 15, 2019, Emilio Montéus was seen for the last time in the borough of Montréal-Nord, Quebec. He ceased contact and we have not heard from him since.

Case reference: 2006011499.CaseDesc: Gordon Berg was a passenger in a boat, fishing on Sturgeon Lake about 125 km west of Armstrong, Ontario, on October 10, 1969. The boat capsized in rough water, and the occupants were thrown into the lake. He was last seen as he drifted away from the boat. He is presumed drowned.

Case reference: 2014001088.CaseDesc: On September 13, 1973, the remains of an adult male were recovered from the Whirlpool of the Niagara River, in Niagara Falls. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 165lbs, however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His eye colour is believed to be brown. He was recovered without clothing.

Ring: Silver ring with a green stone on the third finger of his right hand
Watch: Cloth, Left wrist, had a red, yellow and blue watchstrap.

Case reference: 2020006296.CaseDesc: On October 16, 1964, Carol Turner was last seen with two boys from the Black Diamond Riders Motorcycle Club in Toronto, Ontario. Earlier that evening, Carol had argued with her mother, and left the house after her mother had gone to sleep.

Case reference: 2014004497.CaseDesc: It is believed Vernon Resch may have travelled to British Columbia.  He has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2015015560.CaseDesc: On March 13, 2015, Misty Faith Potts, from the Alexis Nakota Sioux First Nation, was seen for the last time when she had been left at the side of the road to walk a short distance home.

Case reference: 2014004931.CaseDesc: On April 27, 2007, Vimla Patel was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Vimla said she was planning on visiting a family member for the weekend.

Case reference: 2014005870.CaseDesc: On May 22, 2012, André Bellemare was last seen by his wife at his residence in Trois-Rivières, QC. On May 24, 2012, Mr. Bellemare’s vehicle was found abandoned in the woods near the ZEC Tawachiche territory, located in the municipality of Lac-aux-Sables. Despite the discovery of the vehicle, so far the searches have been unsuccessful in locating Mr. Bellemare.

Shirt: Cotton, Blue, White, Plaid, size XL
Shoes: Brown, Size 10, Treking North Face brand

Case reference: 2014004457.CaseDesc: Stephon Payne was last seen at his residence on October 6, 2002. On the same day, Stephon was seen in the area of 106 Avenue and 84 Street, Edmonton, Alberta. Stephon may have also been in the area of the Dawson Bridge in Edmonton. A jacket believed to be Stephon’s was found at the bridge.

Case reference: 2016068715.CaseDesc: On July 21, 2013, the body of an adult male was found floating in the Niagara River across from the Youngstown Marina, near the Niagara on the Lake yacht club. Anthropological analysis has suggested that he is black, although there are some features which suggest that he may be mixed Black and Caucasian. He is described as obese however this may be due to post-mortem changes. He is thought to have been in the water for at least one year, and possibly a few years.

Case reference: 2012020165.CaseDesc: The remains of this male were found in a forested area immediately north of the Port Coquitlam cemetery.

Teeth: Visible Decay, Missing an upper front tooth on the left side prior to death. The upper front tooth on the right side was angled.
Deformity: Left Knee, Osgoode-Schlatter's disease - bony bump on shin below knee

Case reference: 2016069642.CaseDesc: On April 21, 1995, the remains of a woman were discovered near Carbon, Alberta. The post-mortem interval is estimated to be between 10 and 15 years. The individual had dental restorations including stainless steel crowns.

Case reference: 2014003747.CaseDesc: Karoly John "Charles" Horvath, a visitor from England, arrived in Kelowna BC in early May 1989.  He worked throughout the community at part time jobs and stayed in a local hostel and at a local campground.  He was last seen on Friday, May 26, 1989.  All his belongings were left behind at the campground where he had been staying.

Tattoo: Left Upper Arm, side profile of a skull with mohawk style haircut

Case reference: 2020007336.CaseDesc: On December 16, 1970, Abraham Wolfson was seen for the last time leaving a law office in Toronto, Ontario. Abraham had left with certificates worth $50,000 and had come into the city to arrange the sale of a property. Despite the offer of a reward from Abraham’s family, there has been no information pertaining to his whereabouts.

Case reference: 2012020049.CaseDesc: William Krowchuk was last seen leaving his residence in Saskatoon, SK, around 10:00 p.m. on July 9, 1998. The vehicle he was driving at the time of his disappearance was located on July 14, 1998, in the downtown area of Saskatoon.

Deformity: Left Large Toe, No toe nail
Right Large Toe, No toe nail

Case reference: 2014003868.CaseDesc: On Sunday, April 18, 1976, at approximately 12:00 pm, Gary Michael Pinkney departed his residence in Fort Churchill, Manitoba on his snowmobile. He was destined for the Hudson Bay and had planned to return home that same evening. On April 19, 1976, at approximately 8:00 am, Helen Pinkney contacted the Churchill RCMP Detachment and reported that her husband had not yet returned home. Extensive searches were done of the area by land and by air for several days with negative results.   The remains of Mr. Pinkney have not been located and given his intended route, it is presumed that he drowned.

Jewelry: Gold, Gold ring with black stone
Scar: 4 inch scar on either left or right leg
Tattoo: Right Forearm, Eagle with rising sun

Case reference: 2019041509.CaseDesc: On July 17, 2019, at approximately 10:00 am, Kevin Li was seen for the last time leaving his home in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014004091.CaseDesc: Mark Gibbons was seen for the last time on February 1, 1991 at his home in Calgary, Alberta.  He was reported missing by his family and Mark has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2012020055.CaseDesc:
The body of an Asian male was discovered by cleaning staff at the Northbrook Inn in Grand Rapids, Manitoba.  The individual had checked in at 15:30h after arriving on the bus from Winnipeg.  At 18:00h cleaning staff entered the room to find the occupant deceased in a chair.
It was learned that the subject checked into the hotel under the name "CHERON, Deoung".  A small black bag containing herbal medication was located in the room, which after translation from Korean revealed the prescription was issued to "PARK, Seng Dae"(variation of spelling PARK, Sang Dae).  It should be noted that the bus ticket-stub was located with the deceased identified "DUNG" as the individual who purchased the ticket.
Numerous checks were made with variety of agencies in an attempt to determine the man's identity.  It is believed he may be of Korean or Chinese decent.

Case reference: 2021023948.CaseDesc: On May 6, 2021, David Anthony Gale was seen for the last time at the Independent Grocer in Athabasca, Alberta. David has not been seen or heard from since and police are seeking the public's assistance for any information regarding his disappearance.

Case reference: 2014005674.CaseDesc: Ms. Loughran went missing some time on or after March 4, 2006, when she was last seen. Ms. Loughran left the Aspen Grove area of Grovedale, Alberta, in a white Chevrolet truck and was never seen or heard from again.

Case reference: 2020006272.CaseDesc: On October 27, 1962, at approximately midnight, Francis Tan was last seen leaving his residence in Toronto, Ontario. Francis had left his home with two other men.

Coat: Dark Blue, Blazer, McGill University crest on the pocket

Case reference: 2006016899.CaseDesc: Lisa Maas was last seen leaving a party in the Woodford area.

Case reference: 2014005289.CaseDesc: On October 13, 1989, Clara Charles was last seen in Toronto, Ontario. On that day, Clara and her husband were moving and had a friend come over to help them. Clara told her husband that she and her friend were going to bring their furniture to their new address in Brampton, Ontario, and were to return later that evening.

Case reference: 2014004877.CaseDesc: On February 9, 2006, Michelle Mercer was seen for the last time walking away from an argument with her boyfriend, in the area of 105 Street and 69 Avenue in Edmonton, Alberta.

Case reference: 2014004864.CaseDesc: On November 6, 2006, at approximately 9:00 a.m., Ahmed Moalin-Mohamed was seen for the last time as he left his apartment to search for employment in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014021185.CaseDesc: On July 6, 2005, at approximately 1:00 p.m., Kim-Marie Kinsella was seen for the last time in the area of 1695 Jane Street in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2009247848.CaseDesc: Christopher and Alexander are missing from the York region but were located in Poland where they are residing with their non-custodial mother.

Case reference: 2014004667.CaseDesc: The Gypsumville RCMP detachment received a report that an aircraft was in distress over Lake Winnipeg near Reindeer Island. The aircraft, a single engine Cherokee 140, had three people on board; the pilot and two passengers. The pilot had indicated that the engine had seized and that he was trying to make it to Reindeer Island. He then stated that he was going down in to the water. Two RCMP Twin Otters and an Air Search and Rescue Hercules conducted a search by air. It was not possible to search the lake by boat as there was too much ice on the lake. All three are presumed dead due to drowning or from the impact of the crash.

Case reference: 2015050297.CaseDesc: On April, 23, 1973, Lucie Gélinas was seen for the last time in Trois-Rivières, Quebec. She was supposed to go to Vancouver, British Columbia with a friend. Investigations were conducted and the location of Lucie and her friend have been unsuccessful.

Case reference: 2012020044.CaseDesc: On December 23, 1986, Rodney Sloat was seen for the last time, by his friends, in Strathcona County, Alberta. That evening, Rodney was having dinner at his friends’ residence, and had left on his snowmobile at approximately midnight. During the time of his disappearance, Rodney may have been despondent. All of his personal belongings, identification, and snowmobile were found at his residence.

Case reference: 2008003299.CaseDesc: On May 17, 1985, Cyril Cheong was fishing on White Lake with his friends when the weather deteriorated and strong winds started to blow. Mr. Cheong's boat capsized and his friends were unable to save him.  One of his friends saw him, approximately 2 to 3 feet under the water, beyond his reach.

Case reference: 2021055828.CaseDesc: Penny Yaroshuk was last seen leaving her residence in Edmonton, Alberta, on the morning of December 1st, 2021. Penny's vehicle was located abandoned in Hermitage Park, Edmonton, at 12:50 p.m. that same day. Family and friends have not heard from her since.

Case reference: 2006023199.CaseDesc: Kenneth Churney was last seen in March of 1997. He was on a snowmobile travelling northbound toward the trail system head at the rear of Pine Crescent. He never returned from snowmobiling and may have been suffering from mental health issues.

Deformity: Left Ring Finger, 0.5 of an inch shorter

Case reference: 2006022299.CaseDesc: Nick Kostiuk was last seen in a boat leaving a dock on Lower Manitou Lake. He could not swim and his wife saw him leaving without a life jacket. Mr. Kostiuk has been presumed drowned.

Glasses: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, wire frame
Jewelry: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Accutron watch

Case reference: 2023031497.CaseDesc: On 2022-06-02, Michael Vanrookhuyzen was last seen in Chaplin, Saskatchewan where he had mentioned that he was going to see a friend in Toronto, Ontario.  Michael has not been seen or heard from his family or friends in over a year. Michael suffers from paranoid schizophrenia.

Case reference: 2018039090.CaseDesc: On December 6, 1996, at approximately 10:00 a.m., San Lee was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, San was terminally ill and despondent.

Case reference: 2014004496.CaseDesc: Peter Cortner was last seen on May 20, 2004. He was reported missing by his apartment manager where he resided in Downtown Vancouver. He had left all his belongings behind in his apartment suite and dissapeared without notice.

Case reference: 2016059696.CaseDesc: On October 21, 2016, at approximately 1:00 a.m., Michelle Byron was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Coat: Other, WINTER, Dark coloured winter coat

Case reference: 2014005452.CaseDesc: Mr. Hopkins departed his cabin on Sunday, November 2, 1975, to go fishing on Lake Athapapuskow. When he failed to return three days later he was reported missing to police by a friend. Soon thereafter, on November 6th, Mr. Hopkins' boat was located overturned banging against rocks. Numerous personal items were found on shore around the boat. Despite intensive boat patrols and dragging operations, Mr. Hopkins has not been found. Foul play is not suspected, and it is assumed that Mr. Hopkins drowned.

Case reference: 2014003364.CaseDesc: On June 27, 1992, Heather Miller was reported missing by her boyfriend. Ms. Miller was believed to live a transient lifestyle, and could have traveled between Vancouver, BC, Merritt, BC, California, USA, and possibly as far as Australia.

Case reference: 2014002368.CaseDesc: On June 11th, 1969, at approximately 5:50 PM, the Happy Valley-Goose Bay RCMP received a report of an empty boat drifting in Lake Melville, in the vicinity of North West Point, North West River, NL.  Police attended and learned that this empty boat belonged to Lawrence Alton Oliver, who had been reported to have departed his residence earlier in the morning to go seal hunting.  It is believed that Mr. Oliver fell overboard while hunting and drowned.  The body of Mr. Oliver has never been located.

Boots: Rubber, Brown, Red, Rubber hip waders with a red band

Case reference: 2007003699.CaseDesc: On April 9, 2007, a male was located in a forested area north of the intersection of Fiddlers Green Road and Glancaster Road in the community of Mount Hope, Hamilton. He is believed to have been deceased for 7 to 8 months and possibly longer.

Hair: Grey, White, Short, 2-3 inches in length
Teeth: Visible Missing, Upper teeth were lost or removed prior to death. Remaining teeth include 1 canine and 2 premolar teeth on each side of lower jaw
Money: $12.99 with one discolored coin, unknown denomination
Shirt: Denim, Blue, "Kinswood" brand long sleeved button down shirt, size large

Case reference: 2006016999.CaseDesc: Donald Hemsworth was last seen in the area surrounding Twitchgrass and Hilda Lakes, Farr Township on October 8, 1974.

Case reference: 2014002896.CaseDesc: On October 25, 1981, at around 10:00pm, Madeleine Thibault was seen for the last time on Commercial Road in Lévis, Québec. While leaving her house, Madeleine mentioned that she was going to her mother's for a visit.

Jewelry: Gold, COLLIER, Chain with two hearts
Mark: Mouth, Beauty mark on the left side

Case reference: 2014003432.CaseDesc: On August 3, 1979, June Johnson was driven by a friend to the Marlboro Hotel in Prince Albert.  June has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2023030253.CaseDesc: Autumn Shaganash was last seen on June 10, 2023.  She has had no activity on her bank account, no money on her person, and no cellphone. Autumn, according to her immediate family, suffers from depression and anxiety and must take prescribed medication on a daily basis. She hasn't taken her medication since.

Case reference: 2014004678.CaseDesc: On January 23, 1996, at approximately 4:30pm, Isaac and Sara Floresquintana were last seen at their mother’s home in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2015059939.CaseDesc: On October 20, 1973, the remains of a male were recovered from the water near the Fleet Street Pumping Station, Ottawa. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being between 170-180lbs, however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.  It is estimated that he had been in the water between 2 and 3 months.

Case reference: 2014003988.CaseDesc: On February 16, 1989, Gordon Clark was last seen at his residence in Richmond, British Columbia.  He had an argument with his common law wife who left the residence and when she returned home, he was gone.  Gordon has not been heard from or seen by any family members or friends since.

Case reference: 2018010996.CaseDesc: On February 25, 2018, at approximately 11:00pm, Ilya Platonov was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Ilya did not attend school the next morning.

Case reference: 2014005286.CaseDesc: Karl Behr was last seen on December 25, 1981, in Edmonton, Alberta, when he left a family function to return to his residence. It was noted that Karl's green parka and winter boots were missing from his home. Karl speaks with a slight German accent.

Case reference: 2014003388.CaseDesc: Janet Henry was a resident of Vancouver's downtown east side; she struggled with mental health and was engaged in a high risk lifestyle. Despite her challenges, Ms. Henry kept in frequent contact with her family. She was last seen on June 25, 1997, and was reported missing two days later.

Case reference: 2014004872.CaseDesc: Andre Lemieux was last seen on January 9, 2007 in Montreal. He brought his child to daycare and has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2005003899.CaseDesc: On September 5, 2001, a Caucasian male was found on a bench in an outhouse on a cross country ski trail in the Laurentian Hills, Deep River. He was well-tanned and had recently got a sunburn on his face. He was circumcised and his appendix was present. He is estimated to have been dead for two to three days. Biogeographic Ancestry testing predicts this unidentified male is of European ancestry.

Glasses: Copper, Koh Sakai, frame model KS9365, reflective lens
Jeans: Blue, Pepe, size 30, button fly front
Jewelry: Blue, Levi's, Blue faced, built in compass watch
Shoes: Black, Replay, size small running shoes

Case reference: 2014005573.CaseDesc: In November/December 1976, Vernon Loiselle was visiting family in an Edmonton, Alberta hospital. Vernon left the hospital and hasn't been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2017008453.CaseDesc: On September 7, 2015, Lorne Parkes was last seen in Kelowna, British Columbia.

Case reference: 2006026599.CaseDesc: On August 1, 1995, William Reed left his residence and left a note saying he was going fishing. His truck was located parked near Gibson Mill Road, Phelps Township, with the keys and his wallet inside.

Hat: Green, cap with white lettering on the front

Case reference: 2022054292.CaseDesc: Steven Blanchette Rochefort was reported missing on October 26, 2022. The last footprint of life for Steven Blanchette Rochefort was on July 11, 2022, in Calgary, Alberta.

Case reference: 2014005006.CaseDesc: On September 10, 2007, Sun Jin, her husband Joon Han, and their daughter Il Han were seen for the last time at a school in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2012020017.CaseDesc: Stephen Begg was reported missing February 16, 2011.  Mr. Begg struggled with alcoholism and depression.

Case reference: 2015066998.CaseDesc:
Yvon Shawn Guignard moved to the northern part of Manitoba during the summer of 2015 in search of employment, with interests in Churchill and the Northwest Territories. While in Thompson, he adopted a transient lifestyle, living in his personal vehicle and developing friendships with the homeless community. 
It’s believed Mr. Guignard was last seen on November 28, 2015 at approximately 6:45am. Just prior to his disappearance, he made a number of attempts to give away his personal vehicle, which was located at the time he was reported missing. According to his family, he is schizophrenic, with a medical condition and he also has a history of not taking his prescription medications. He has been known to travel to undisclosed locations within the country and act secretive with family as to his whereabouts. He should not be approached as he may be in medical distress.

Case reference: 2014004949.CaseDesc: On June 3, 1968, it was reported that George Knott had been missing since the previous day. He had been traveling by boat between St. Theresa and Garden Hill, Manitoba. George's boat and dog were located. All attempts to locate him failed and he remains missing.

Scar: Left Shin, 1 inch lateral scar across left shin - axe wound
Left Knee, 1.5 inch lateral scar across inside left knee - axe wound
Left Foot, 1.5 inch lateral scar across top left foot - axe wound
1 inch lateral scar inside of right or left foot - axe wound

Case reference: 2014004628.CaseDesc: On April 18, 2005, Patrick Marshall was last seen when he left his residence in the North East area of Jean Cote, Alberta. Patrick had left a note indicating that he would be travelling to Calgary with a friend. The note also indicated that he would be in contact within a few weeks. When he left, Patrick left with minimal clothes and toiletries.

Hair: Brown, Short, Dark brown, turning grey

Case reference: 2012020139.CaseDesc: On November 15, 1981, 16 year old Myriam Isabelle Kniaz was seen for the last time at the residence of her foster family located in Ste-Foy, Quebec .

Case reference: 2014003239.CaseDesc: Craig Rain was last seen at a gas station at Range Road 32 and Highway 16 north of Duffield, Alberta. He had been planning to hitch hike into Edmonton, Alberta, from this location.

Tattoo: Right Upper Arm, Persons head with feathers

Case reference: 2016061831.CaseDesc: On September 1, 1980, a caucasian male, believed to be between the ages of 50 to 65 years old, was found at the bottom of the fourth floor stairway of the parking garage at 50 Cumberland Avenue in Yorkville, Toronto. He had trauma to his face and skull possibly due to a fall down the stairs. His appendix was present and he was circumcised.

Hair: Brown, Grey, Short, Beard of a couple of days
Teeth: Visible Missing, Many of his teeth were lost some time before death and some of the remaining teeth had cavities. He had no dental work.
Pants: Brown, Blue, Light brown, plaid, Levi's brand
Shirt: Yellow, Long sleeved sport shirt with "Stevenson 114" written on the inside of the collar
Shorts: Light Blue, Dark Blue, Checkered, size 30 from Sears

Case reference: 2021000139.CaseDesc: On January 1st, 2021, Zachery Lefave was last seen around 12:30 a.m., talking on a cellular phone while walking on Highway # 334 in the Plymouth region of Yarmouth County, Nova Scotia. Zachery had left a New Year’s Eve party that was being held in the area.

Case reference: 2014004257.CaseDesc: On March 24, 2003, Paul David Garcia was reported missing by his family in Chilliwack, British Columbia. Mr. Garcia left home in March 1997 leaving his vehicle and personal effects behind.

Case reference: 2014005084.CaseDesc: On February 1, 2008, it is suspected the Kevin Leroux went through the ice on his ATV, near St Joseph's Cove, NL. His ATV was recovered several months later, about 22 km from where he was suspected of going through the ice but his body was never found.

Case reference: 2014002175.CaseDesc: On October 29, 1983, Dale Dushinski was seen for the last time. During the time of his disappearance, Dale was canoeing on the Athabasca River. His canoe was later found overturned approximately 10 kms north of Fort McMuray, Alberta.

Scar: A scar from a biopsy, unsure which knee

Case reference: 2020006647.CaseDesc: On June 27, 1980, Ophlin Facey was seen for the last time as she left the residence of her employer. During the time of her disappearance, Ophlin was a live-in house keeper, and it is possible she may have been heading to a party that day.

Case reference: 2014005701.CaseDesc: On November 11, 2011, at approximately 7:00 a.m., Dezso Junaszka was seen for the last time as he left his residence to go to work in Toronto, Ontario.

Coat: Denim, Blue, Brown, Large white logo on the back and left breast "UNK"
Shoes: White, Running, Running shoes; possibly "Puma" brand

Case reference: 2006018099.CaseDesc: On January 4, 1994, David Ernest Rowbotham was last seen in the Belleville/Trenton Ontario area.

Case reference: 2014004240.CaseDesc: Sheilagh Coleman was reported missing on August 22, 2000 by her mother. Her mother last saw her on August 1, 2000 when she visited her in Gibsons, B.C. The last reliable sighting of Sheilagh was believed to be August 21, 2000 by a neighbour. They saw her leaving the residence of her boyfriend on her bicycle. Numerous people were interviewed that were associated to her and was much contradiction regarding the dates and events in order of which Sheilagh was last seen.

Case reference: 2012020034.CaseDesc: The Edmonton Police Service is seeking assistance in locating Dylan Steven Koshman. He was last seen on October 12, 2008 on the south side of Edmonton.

Case reference: 2020006644.CaseDesc: On July 6, 1980, Andrew Jenkins was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, Andrew may have been despondent.

Scar: Left Side Of Neck, Two inches
